financial_literacy_test_1_title: Ready for a card? Prove it!
financial_literacy_test_1_description: Take the card test! Show off your skills! Tell the world!
financial_literacy_test_1_question_1: How do you get money on the card?
financial_literacy_test_1_question_2: Can you buy a pair of headphones for £249 if your balance is £239?
financial_literacy_test_1_question_3: What should you do with the card's PIN code?
financial_literacy_test_1_question_4: What happens if you enter the wrong PIN code three times?
financial_literacy_test_1_question_5: What should you do if you see a transaction you don’t remember making?
financial_literacy_test_1_question_6: What's the most important thing to think about when shopping online?
financial_literacy_test_1_question_7: What happens if you take out a subscription that costs £99 per month?
financial_literacy_test_1_question_8: Should you lend your card to someone else?
financial_literacy_test_1_question_9: What should you do if you lose your card?
financial_literacy_test_1_question_10: What should you do if someone asks you for your card number and CVV code?
financial_literacy_test_1_question_1_opt: Someone who knows your bank details will deposit money into your account
The card is connected to the central bank, anyone can use the money there
I put the card in my wallet with my cash
financial_literacy_test_1_question_2_opt: Yes, how will the shop know how much money I have on the card?
Yes, but then I will owe the bank 10
No, I can't buy the headphones because there's not enough money on the card
financial_literacy_test_1_question_3_opt: Write it on the back of the card
Write it on a piece of papper and put it in your wallet
Learn it off by heart and do not share it with anyone
financial_literacy_test_1_question_4_opt: I have to pay twice as much
The money on the card disappears
financial_literacy_test_1_question_5_opt: Block the card until I have investigated the reason.
Deposit more money onto the card
financial_literacy_test_1_question_6_opt: That I get the best deals
That I buy from a secure website
That I can get home delivery
financial_literacy_test_1_question_7_opt: 99 will be automatically taken from my account each month
I have to pay 99 in interest each month
financial_literacy_test_1_question_8_opt: Yes, but only to those who really need help
Yes, but only to someone the same age as me
No, you should not lend your card to anyone else
financial_literacy_test_1_question_9_opt: Nothing, if I haven't used the card for a week, a new one will be sent to me
financial_literacy_test_1_question_10_op: I will tell them my card number and CVV code
I will only tell them my CVV code because the card number is secret
I won't tell them either, both are secret
financial_literacy_test_2_description: Do the Earning test and get financial superskills!
financial_literacy_test_2_question_1: Anna likes math, but not writing or working with her hands. Which job suits her the best?
financial_literacy_test_2_question_2: Lina is a dogwalker. Ella has an internship at a school. Nora is a hairdresser. Lars is studying medicine. Who has an income?
financial_literacy_test_2_question_3: Jimmy lends a friend £1000. A year later he gets £1100 back. What are the extra £100 called?
financial_literacy_test_2_question_4: Leo wants a £1000 loan. Which one should he choose to pay as little interest as possible?
financial_literacy_test_2_question_5: Kim has earned £4000 by selling 1000 cookies. If the cost was £3000, what was the profit?
financial_literacy_test_2_question_6: Daniel sells mobile phones. He gets £300 per each sold phone. What are the £300 called?
financial_literacy_test_2_question_7: Johan has started a company. What will his company make if it's successful?
financial_literacy_test_2_question_4_opt: A short-term loan with a high interest rate
A short-term loan with a low interest rate
A long-term loan with a high interest rate
A long-term loan with a low interest rate
financial_literacy_test_3_description: Do the Saving test and get financial superskills!
financial_literacy_test_3_question_1: Many people invest their money. What do they expect an increase in?
financial_literacy_test_3_question_3: Earned interest that is kept on the account makes the interest higher with time. What's this called?
financial_literacy_test_3_question_4: What does it mean to be a shareholder?
financial_literacy_test_3_question_5: When is Johanna making an investment?
financial_literacy_test_3_question_6: Konrad earns £2000 and deposits £500 in a different account to not spend them. What is he doing?
financial_literacy_test_3_question_7: You ride your bike wearing a helmet. Kim rides without a helmet. What's true about the risk?
financial_literacy_test_3_question_8: Stella gets £50 and spends £40 each week. How many weeks does it take for her to afford a book for £100?
financial_literacy_test_3_question_9: Danilo is paying a company to cover his costs in the event of an accident. What's this called?
financial_literacy_test_3_question_10: Moa is saving her money in a box, not in a savings account. What is she doing?
financial_literacy_test_3_question_4_opt: You lend money to a company
You borrow money from a bank
You own a part of a company
You manage salaries at a company
financial_literacy_test_3_question_5_opt: When she buys a new dishwasher
When she opens a bank account
When she gets a new credit card
When she buy stocks in a company
financial_literacy_test_3_question_7_opt: Both you and Kim reduce your risk of head injuries
Both you and Kim accept the risk of head injuries
You reduce your risk and Kim accepts his risk of head injuries
You accept your risk and Kim reduces his risk of head injuries
financial_literacy_test_4_description: Do the Spending test and get financial superskills!
financial_literacy_test_4_question_1: Maria is shopping for school start. What's the smartest way for her to spend her money?
financial_literacy_test_4_question_2: What's an inevitable part of everyday life?
financial_literacy_test_4_question_3: What do most people usually do in order to afford to buy a house?
financial_literacy_test_4_question_4: Bella is making a budget. What's the most important thing to keep track of?
financial_literacy_test_4_question_5: Linnéa buys a basketball. Why do you think she buys it?
financial_literacy_test_4_question_6: What's the biggest advantage of borrowing money?
financial_literacy_test_4_question_7: Sara and Maria have the exact same cars, but Sara's insurance costs more. Why?
financial_literacy_test_4_question_8: Julia has £300 on her card and wants to buy headphones for £500. Can she buy them?
financial_literacy_test_4_question_1_opt: To buy things she doesn't want on sale
To buy whatever her friends are buying
To list things she wants and check the price in advance
financial_literacy_test_4_question_3_opt: Get a loan from a bank
financial_literacy_test_4_question_6_opt: You can buy now and pay later
You can buy now and avoid paying
financial_literacy_test_4_question_7_opt: Sara doesn't have a savings account
Sara is not going to college
Sara got fired from a job
financial_literacy_test_4_question_8_opt: Yes, it takes two months for the money to be withdrawn
Yes, the store doesn't know how much money she has
No, she needs at least £1000 on the card
